question: 嘘つき
sourceMnemonic: If <kanji>lies</kanji> puke (<ja>吐く</ja>) out of your mouth, you're a <vocabulary>liar</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a combination of the kun'yomi readings, one of which you haven't seen yet. You'll usually see this word without the <ja>吐</ja> kanji, as in <ja>嘘つき</ja>, but for now let's learn its kanji reading! 

You can't just tell one <vocabulary>lie</vocabulary>, it always turns into <reading>two</reading> (<ja>つ</ja>). Kind of like a chip or pretzel, you can't just have one. With lies, you have to open your mouth for two more. And then two more.... and... well you get it.
